channel.title: Blog on dnv
channel.description: Recent content in Blog on dnv

item.title: Red Oak Ladder Bookshelf
item.description:
Last week I finished a project that is a (delayed) birthday gift for Shiva, and she liked it (well, it was designed to her specifications :)

I made every mistake I could as a beginner-woodworker. Sloppy cuts happened all over the place and I had to sand everything extensively. Another problem was the choice of wrong joints - I used pocket hole screw with Kreg jig, with two screws per joint, and is not a very strong joint as it turned out. The filler in the corners of the shlef-vertical struts joints is cracking… But from 1 meter away all the imperfections are not easy to see and that’s good for the first project!

item.title: Our lightweight eyewear work is summarized in a paper and available through UIST 2020 archive!
item.description: This post briefly summarizes the work I’ve done while at Google Research, around 2018-2019 timeframe.

item.title: Multiple Input Multiple Output Switch aka MIMOSA went open source!
item.description:
MIMOSA is designed to be the most versatile user interface for wide veriety of applications. The project just is now open-source hardware and the materials are available on Github.

The hardware is based on versatile nRF52840, with rich libraries support. Also can be configured to work with CircuitPython such that it is very easy to configure for everyone! More firmware and software work will be available soon.

Github Page
